Description: Fragment giving profile except for underside of foot of Corinthian pottery plate; flaring wall and rounded rim with two grooves on top; rounded ring foot; glaze fired brown and very worn; outside of rim and probably all of foot glazed; band at outer edge of top of rim perhaps extending over grooves; traces of bands at junction with tondo; between, black-figure decoration consisting perhaps of body of animal (traces of faded glaze and incision marks).
Curator's comments: Likely to be from same plate as 1924,1201.1227.a, b, d and e, where traces of decoration on the top are not readily seen save for some possible incision on 1227.b.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.120) (Phase 1)
